name: Stroopwafels with Treacle
author: Magda
summary: We all love stroopwafels with a cup of coffee or tea - it's a favorite Dutch treat. Try making them at home with this recipe!
directions: Combine flour, 1 cup melted butter, white sugar, milk, egg, and yeast in a large bowl
Knead until dough is smooth and elastic
Cover loosely with plastic wrap and let rise, about 45 minutes
Heat treacle, brown sugar, 1/4 cup butter, and cinnamon in a small saucepan over medium heat until melted together, 3 to 5 minutes
Mix well until filling is smooth
Preheat a shallow waffle iron according to manufacturer's instructions
Knead dough briefly and divide it into balls about 1 1/2 inches in diameter, or as needed to fit your waffle iron
Bake 1 ball of dough the preheated iron until golden brown and iron stops steaming, 30 seconds to 1 minute
Press down with a round cutter to trim edges for a perfect circle
Carefully slice horizontally into 2 rounds while still hot
Spread 1 to 2 tablespoons of the filling on each round and sandwich together
